To encrypt the message "MATH" using the Hill cipher with the given key K, we first need to convert the letters into numerical values using the alphabetical index (A=0, B=1, ..., Z=25).

M = 12
A = 0
T = 19
H = 7

Now, we need to arrange these values into a 2x2 matrix (plaintext matrix P) and multiply it by the key matrix K.

P = \begin{bmatrix}
12 & 19 \\
0 & 7
\end{bmatrix}

Now, multiply the key matrix K by the plaintext matrix P:

K * P = \begin{bmatrix}
1 & 2 \\
3 & 5
\end{bmatrix}
*
\begin{bmatrix}
12 & 19 \\
0 & 7
\end{bmatrix}
=
\begin{bmatrix}
12 & 43 \\
36 & 112
\end{bmatrix}

Now, we need to take the resulting matrix and apply the modulo 26 operation to each element:

\begin{bmatrix}
12 & 43 \\
36 & 112
\end{bmatrix}
(mod 26)
=
\begin{bmatrix}
12 & 17 \\
10 & 8
\end{bmatrix}

Now, we need to convert these numerical values back into letters:

12 = M
17 = R
10 = K
8 = I

So, the encrypted message using the Hill cipher with the given key K is "MRKI".
